comment: She is extremely difficult to understand and almost impossible to hear her if you sit more than 2 rows back. She scrolls through the powerpoint and scribbles on the board, but you can;'t even hear her explanations. If you struggle with math in general, it is going to be impossible to learn in her class.

Honestly she is not that bad. It's just kind of boring to be present in the class since she does have a monotone voice and it's lecture heavy. As long as you take notes from ALEKS and do the assignments on there you should be fine. She extends her deadlines a lot, so I find it hard to fail as long as you do your work.
She's very hard to understand, condensing , and will call you out if you're on your phone even though its nearly impossible to understand her. Also, moves very fast through her powerpoints.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: This girl give me a D for the class on degree works, but I had a C on Aleks for the class, and her English is Terrible. It does not matter what u have in the class if u don't get at least a 50 on that crazy final exam u fail.

I don't get the negative comments. I took her 95% online class. She extended the module date multiple times for people to improve their grades. She replies to emails faster. Just focus on ALEKS and you are good.
Not a good teacher, don't take if you want to learn. Chatgpt taught me how to do the math problems better than her.
She is tough and ocasionally rude

I took Professor Pashchenko to College Algebra 1111. And all I'm going to say is that she was a nice lady, but she wasn't a very good professor. She taught the material strangely and moved too quick. The only way I learned in the class was through ALEKS and getting outside help from peers. Piece of advice make friends in the class, you'll need it.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: She's a nice lady, but she isn't the best at teaching. I felt that the ALEKS she assigns teaches me the material way better than she does. Class isn't hard tho, but she does give a quiz every class period locked with a password for attendance reasons and the quiz closes when her class period ends.

This professor has a very heavy accent which makes it hard to understand her lectures. She is not very good at teaching the material, most of the stuff I taught myself through ALEKS, makes practice tests that are identical to the actual exam, lets you have a cheat sheet during exams (not the final tho). quizzes everyday and weekly homework.

She honestly is not bad but does have an accent. If youre good at algebra/math this class will be very easy for you. Doesnt take attendance but has pop quizzes so people still show up and they usually are 1-2 questions. All her practice tests are the exact same as her quizzes and tests. She will call you out if youre on your phone or using airpods.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Online Savvy

comment: MASSIVE WASTE OF TIME, TEARS, MONEY!!! DO NOT CHOOSE AS YOUR PROFFESSOR. CAN'T SPEAK ENGLISH!!!!!!!!
Overall, the class is mostly online leading there to be little to no reason to come in. Except she places pop quizzes nearly every day that you are not allowed to take outside of class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: PRECALC. If you're good at math and capable of teaching yourself some things you should be fine with her. She has a Russian accent, so it is sometime difficult to understand her, and some things that she says are rude without her noticing. She'll give you extra credit if needed and allows a notebook paper cheat sheet every test.

Very VERY heavy accent. Can be hard to understand sometimes. If algebra is easy for you, then this class is fine since most of the material is done online but she does not allow phones in her class. I suggest taking a different teacher to make your morning a little less stressful.

Good professor and clearly understands what she is teaching however her accent made it hard to learn. Class is easily able to be self-taught if you are good at math as everything is in ALEKS, but I would not recommend her if you have difficulty in math.
She does everything to make sure you get a decent grade

She was sweet but her accent made it hard to learn. This course is easy to self-teach, but if you are bad at that I would not recommend. She would also stop lectures if a student had a phone out or was talking. I stopped going after a few lectures. Not too much homework and not too many tests, but a good amount.

Her class was easy since it was only based on homework and a few exams. Her lectures are straight off a powerpoint which makes coming to class kind of optional. she does tend to get distracted by telling students to get off their phones and take off their earbuds very often.

This is a very easy class so I recommend that you take it. Homework for each chapter, test can be taken online in person, and you are allowed a cheat sheet for the tests. There are practice tests for each of the tests as well which are basically just like the real test. She really doesn't like it when you're on your phone or pack up early.

I do not understand why her rating is so low. She gives clear instructions and always asks if everyone is understanding and explains if you have a question. She gets mad if you use headphones or try to pack late which can be a bit frustrating. But overall she cares and wants her students to succeed on her class. You just have to ask.

I tool pre-calc online (asynchronous) with Professor Pashchenko and she was fine. She used the ALEKS for assignments and lockdown with camera for tests. However her tests were identical to the practice tests, so if you run that a few times you will pass. The modules can be hefty but you have good time to complete them. Take her online if you can.

She's tough to follow and often makes things more complicated than they need to be.  If you are someone who asks questions in class, I won't take her as she often does not understand the question. Homework and tests are on ALEKS. Practice tests are the same as the test but with different numbers. Can be annoying if you have her in the morning.

She doesn't really teach! She pulls up a powerpoint and says "do you understand?". I learned more from the ALEKS lessons than from her. She can be a little rude sometimes. Overall, the class is easy if you already know what you're doing.

This professor is terrible. Not online savvy. She uses proctor u which is extra money and does not work most of the time. You go to take a test and you will miss your test window due to proctor u software not working. She uses Aleks. She also told me there was no way to calculate my final grade until after I had taken the final. Do not take!
Just show up and look at the PowerPoints. Nothing is difficult and you're allowed a cheat sheet. The easiest math class you'll ever have and the Professor is pretty laid back.

Honestly confused as to why her score is so low here. She is incredibly clear with what the course material is and how to prepare. I feel people here are a little harsh on her accent; I always understood what she was trying to say in class, despite some grammatical errors from time to time. Overall a nice person and will work with you if you ask.
heavy accent but overall not a bad teacher, tries her best to explain if you have questions but not always understandable. most material i had to self teach
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Thick accent but shes a nice teacher. Most of these comments r negative which I understand. My only downside w her was the accent bc its a little hard to understand but the homework makes up most of ur grade and this content is so easy. Tests are EXACTLY as the practice test and theyre on lockdown browser. Make sure to go to tutoring sessions!
Never take Quantitative Reasoning with Ms. Pashckenko. Simple as that.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I had her for an online summer course as and she was great! i never had to interact with her because everything you need to know is in the syllabus. Class is through ALEKS and there are 13 Hw assignments and the tests are taken on proctorU. The tests ARE IDENTICAL TO THE STUDY GUIDE. if you practice the study guide you will EASILY get an A+

Do your homework that counts for most of your grades, you can have a cheat sheet on tests. I couldn't access the homework for the first month of school, she wouldn't give me any alternatives, pretty much told me to figure it out. Uses ALEKS but it does all the teaching work so unless you have questions or need a review, you'll be bored in class.
Fair. Has fair grading and is flexible with students. Kind. I can see how she can be tough if you lack discipline. Just be respectful.

She's sweet but very old-fashioned. Will not allow you to use a calculator whatsoever for her tests. She uses LockDown Browser & you have to attend in person for her tests. All the classwork & tests are taken through a program called ALEKS. Hardly explains how to do problems other than reading off a 30 pg PowerPoint Slide. Visual Learners Beware.

Very thick accent. Just get's up and does a math problem and does not explain the steps. Do not ask question because she doesn't answer them she will say "Did you see me do the problem?" Only graded on test and homework. No extra credit. Have to take exams in person. Do not recommend unless you know how to teach yourself.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: She explains things in the most complicated way and is very boring. Her homework is annoying because if you dont get 3 right in a row you have to start over on the topic, and there are usually 20 topics per homework. The second you touch your phone whether its to check the time or take a picture of her PowerPoint, she will call you out.

Do no take. Very heavy accent and was extremely difficult to understand her. Calculators are never allowed whatsoever. Terrible at actually explaining how to do the math, so if you are already bad at math she is awful at actually helping you understand (which a math professor should do). Be ready to teach yourself.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Overall Professor Pashchenko is good. You're allowed to use 1 page of notes for tests and a flaschard for the final. The test reviews guarantee you success on the tests if you do them. The homeworks are tough but if you complete them you will be prepared for the tests. In class she goes over hw examples and answer questions, which was helpful.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: She is terrible at speaking English she is so hard to understand. It is so hard to get lost she has no idea how to teach and is so hard to understand. If I could link videos of her talking I would never take her take an online class before you take her class it is awful. She goes too fast and never really explains herself. Never take her class.

She has a thick accent and does not understand most of the questions students ask during class. She makes it difficult to make up assignments if you go out of town for work. I taught myself from Aleks. You do not get graded for attendance, students who went to her class compared to those who didn't, got worse grades. Allowed cheat sheet for tests.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: I am so surprised that Prof Pashchenko received such low ratings! Loved her! HW on ALEKS, very knowledgable about math, takes attendance, thick accent (sit close), strong policy against phones, lets you have front & back paper cheat sheet for every test, gives practice tests (EXACT format of real tests). Recommend if you are good at math already.

Worst Prof. ever had. Shes very rude and sarcastic. She reads off the PowerPoint and sometimes says search it up on your own time bc idk how to do it. Theres some people who take paper tests, and she went crazy on them. I thought about dropping the class since she isnt helpful what do ever. Aleks and a tutor is teaching me. Still failing.
Might be the worst math teacher at KSU. Only reads off the powerpoints, doesn't explain well in detail when asked a question. I have never regretted not withdrawing from a class more.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: When she is teaching its like she does not know what she I talking about

Professor Paschenko has a thick accent and speaks somewhat softly so sit near the front. Her power points are unique in that she shows you the steps all at once and doesnt really go over it. As long as you actually do the online homework, the class is easy. Shes also very funny and seems to genuinely care about your success.
Doesnt explain how to solve problems well at all, and doesnt let you use a calculator for anything. You can have a cheat sheet for tests which is good because you wont learn anything in that class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Lots of homework

comment: All your work is going to be online, and it's FAST so get ready to forget everything if you have bad memorization. Secondly, she doesn't know what she's doing. We have a "knowledge check" or what I assume is graded as a test that for some reason we have to START by 2 pm today? However, we don't even have her class today.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Test heavy
